title: Garcia’s Take: Investors Favor Mining Over Oil and Gas
sub_head: With the need for lithium, nickel and other metals in renewable-energy technologies like EV batteries, many view the mining sector as vital to the shift to clean energy
body:
Institutional investors in real assets are continuing to pour capital into mining funds—even as they shun oil- and gas-focused strategies—deepening a divergence between two natural resource sectors often seen as similar.
Rising demand for lithium, nickel and other metals vital to renewable-energy technologies, like electric-vehicle batteries, is drawing interest to a sector once dismissed as not just polluting, but prone to environmental disasters and accidents like explosions and landslides.
